label: Letter from Francis Marion to Nathanael Greene
description: Letter from Francis Marion to Nathanael Greene regarding the movements of the enemy around South Carolina, the fitness of his men, and the renewing of clothing supplies for the corps.

metadata.label: Description

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
[Francis Marion to Nathanael Greene
December 30, 1781
[RvW Box 1 Folder 34; MSS. – A.L.S.]]

St Johns' Parish Near Strawberry
Sir	ferry 30th Dec.r 1781 –
On my return I found a party of the
Enemy had penetrated from haddrells point
to Bosis Plant.n in Cain-hoy, with an Intention
to surprise Col.o [Colonel] Screven who I had Left
with Eighty men to prevent small partys [sic]
of the Enemy from ravaging the Country
on Wando river, but they mist [missed] their Aim
the Col. [Colonel] followed them down some distance
[and] had a few scattering fire on them, wound-
-ed four, without having one man hurt.
Since that no attempt have been made
I was Oblige[d] to move from Hugers Bridge
to this Place for want of Forrage [sic], keeping
Large Detatchments [sic] on the Wando river
near Wappetaw [and] at Fogarties [and] Addison
ferry –
Inclosed [sic] is the returns of Col.o [Colonel] Horry
[and] Mahams Corps, which I shall Cloath [sic]
Compleatly [sic] in a Little time having found
Means to get Cloathing [sic] out of town –
I have been Offered a great Quantity
of Articles for Soldiers, [and] Expect to secure
them soon, [and] hope to spare your troops
a Large quantity –
I have the Honor to be your
Ob.t S.t [Obedient Servant]
Frans. [Francis] Marion
[End Page 1]
[Address:]                  Public Service
The Hon.ble Maj.r Gen. l [Honorable Major General] Green[e]
Express
Fr [Francis] Marion
[Endorsed upside down:]  G.G
General Greene
[End Page 2]
